results.title: With Michael in Kyuso, Kenya
results.creator_credit: David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions
results.brief_description: Focuses on the life of a young boy living in a village in Kenya. Shows the role of education, the links between the village and the towns and the impact of technology on employment prospects in the village.

results.title: The Voyage of Odysseus
results.creator_credit: Pieter Van Deusen and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: An adaptation of that part of Homer’s Odyssey dealing with the 10 year ordeal of returning home to Ithaca. Stylized visuals are used to recount the story of Odysseus and his companions as they experience the adventures and terrors of the epic journey, notably with the Cyclops, the Laestrygonians, Circe, the inhabitants of Hades, the Sirens, Scylla and Charybdis, Aeolus, Helios and the sacred cattle and Calypso. Narrated by Julie Harris. Models, sculpture and monster animation by John Matthews. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Insects that live in big families
results.brief_description: Examines the habits and social systems of insects that live in large groups, including bees, wasps, ants, ants, aphids and termites. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Insects helpful to man
results.brief_description: Shows how humans benefit from the the activities of some insects. Includes a discussion of the benefits derived from bees, silkworms, maggots, dung beetles, lady bugs and ichneumon flies. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Tommy's world
results.creator_credit: Margot Lethlean and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Made with the help of Myra Hilsendorf and Victoria’s Art Project, this film utilizes the art of mentally retarded people to provide an indication of their potential capabilities. Introduces the view to Tommy’s world through his drawings and also shows the paintings of other handicapped people. The vitality, immediacy and emotional impact of their work challenges the viewer to examine conventional attitudes towards handicapped people. No dialogue, musical background only.

results.title: Walkaway prices
results.creator_credit: Jack Zalkalns and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A dramatized re-enactment of an adolescent boy’s increasing involvement in petty theft and vandalism due to the peer pressure exerted on him by two other boys. His fears of being detected are eventually borne out when two detectives appear at the school and ask to see him. Cast includes: Robert Clarkson, Dam Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: What's cooking?
results.creator_credit: Damian Brown, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Presents a humorous look at the health problems which abound in the unhygienic kitchen and shows how to overcome these through following sanitary procedures. The film covers proper refridgeration of food, observation of shelf life of food products, how to recognise blown cans and the need to avoid using the same utensils for cooked and uncooked food. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Just out of reach
results.creator_credit: Linda Blagg, Ross Matthews and Portrait Films
results.brief_description: A contemporary drama featuring Lorna Lesley, Sam Neill and Martin Vaughan. Portrays a young woman’s conflicts with her parents, her love affair while still at school, her marriage to her former teacher, their subsequent separation and the near disastrous effects it has upon her life. In tracing an archetypal journey from adolescence to adulthood, the film probes both the ‘silences of family life’ and the tenuousness of relationships. Suitable for senior students. Teacher preview recommended.

results.title: Preserving Egypt's past
results.brief_description: Reveals many of the impressive monuments built by the ancient Egyptians such as the pyramids at Giza and the temples at Karnak, Luxor and Abu Simbal: it also looks at the enormous task faced by archaeologists and Egyptologists in their struggle to preserve the artifacts of Egypt’s past, which are deteriorating at an alarming rate due to population increase, tourism and the Nile’s rising waters. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels. Includes teacher’s guide.

results.title: Living cells
results.brief_description: Uses the phase contrast optical system to show that living cells are very active structures. Shows how movement can be detected in the cytoplasm of the cells, ranging from a streaming movement of the early cytoplasm to movements by a whole variety of cellular organelles. The cell surface also exhibits movement, and even in the case of multicellularorganisms, movement of the whole cell can be observed. Suitable for upper secondary level.
